docs.lead_paragraph: A budding bipartisan deal to shelter physicians from Medicare cuts, championed by the House's two top leaders, is drawing powerful allies including the American Medical Association and a rainbow of conservative and liberal groups.

headline.main: Potent Groups Take Sides on Bipartisan House Medicare Plan
headline.print_headline: Potent Groups Take Sides on Bipartisan House Medicare Plan

docs.snippet: A budding bipartisan deal to shelter physicians from Medicare cuts, championed by the House's two top leaders, is drawing powerful allies including the American Medical Association and a rainbow of conservative and liberal groups.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two years since undergoing amputations after receiving a treatment known as a ringer, Myung Hwa Jang has become comfortable with daily routines like climbing into bed and grocery shopping.

headline.main: A Life Upended After an IV Glucose Treatment Popular Among Asian Immigrants
headline.print_headline: A Life Upended After an IV Treatment Popular Among Immigrants

docs.abstract: Plight of Queens woman Myung Hwa Jang is cautionary tale about dangers of glucose injections, practice that is popular pick-me-up among Asian immigrants; Jang has learned to adapt to her new normal two years after infection from intravenous glucose procedure resulted in multiple amputations; Jang has filed lawsuit against Queens medical clinic where she received injections.
docs.snippet: Two years since undergoing amputations after receiving a treatment known as a ringer, Myung Hwa Jang has become comfortable with daily routines like climbing into bed and grocery shopping.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers say the milk is brimming with potential therapeutic agents, for babies and also possibly adults.

headline.main: Breast Milk Becomes a Commodity, With Mothers Caught Up in Debate
headline.print_headline: Worries Vie With Hopes as Breast Milk Becomes Big Business

docs.abstract: Breast milk is among latest frontiers of biotechnology industry, thereby becoming an industrial commodity; researchers say they hope to synthesize and distill variety of potential therapeutics from breast milk for treatment of varied diseases; skeptics of fledgling industry have expressed concerns, particularly about how it will impact nonprofit milk banks.
docs.snippet: Researchers say the milk is brimming with potential therapeutic agents, for babies and also possibly adults.

headline.main: Cedar Lake Contemporary Ballet Plans to Close

docs.abstract: The company, founded by the Walmart heiress Nancy Laurie, had generous contracts for dancers and its own Chelsea theater.
docs.snippet: The company, founded by the Walmart heiress Nancy Laurie, had generous contracts for dancers and its own Chelsea theater.

docs.lead_paragraph: House aides released an outline late Friday of an emerging bipartisan deal shielding physicians from Medicare cuts and pumping more funds to popular programs for children's health and community health centers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said Friday it's making progress trying to correct a tax-form error that affected 820,000 customers of HealthCare.gov.

docs.snippet: The Obama administration said Friday it's making progress trying to correct a tax-form error that affected 820,000 customers of HealthCare.gov.

headline.main: Recycling Unused Medicines to Save Money and Lives

docs.abstract: A non-profit service makes it easier for health care agencies to send unused medications to the poor.
docs.snippet: A non-profit service makes it easier for health care agencies to send unused medications to the poor.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than half of the undergraduates at the University of Oregon have not been vaccinated against meningitis, despite the fact that one student has died and five others have been sickened since January.

headline.main: Officials Urge Meningitis Shots at University of Oregon
headline.print_headline: Officials Urge Meningitis Shots at University of Oregon

docs.snippet: More than half of the undergraduates at the University of Oregon have not been vaccinated against meningitis, despite the fact that one student has died and five others have been sickened since January.

docs.lead_paragraph: These Horatio Algerians for the new Gilded Age are virtuous because they made it, or vice versa. And those who haven’t managed a similar leap are just weaklings.
docs.abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column argues members of Republican party, as exemplified by House Speaker John Boehner, Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker and Sen Joni Ernst, are betraying their own professed humble roots and modest class origins by working to keep struggling workers down; holds raising minimum wage and maintaining health care subsidies will strengthen economy, not weaken it as Republicans contend.
docs.snippet: These Horatio Algerians for the new Gilded Age are virtuous because they made it, or vice versa. And those who haven’t managed a similar leap are just weaklings.

docs.lead_paragraph: The modern Republican Party’s raw fiscal dishonesty is something new in American politics.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column warns Republican-proposed budget represents new height in fiscal dishonesty; says promise of huge cuts in spending and revenue increases without explaining where money will come from is trend specific to new breed of Republican lawmakers; says budget would result in large transfer of income from poor and working class to rich and would leave United States several trillion dollars deeper in debt.
docs.snippet: The modern Republican Party’s raw fiscal dishonesty is something new in American politics.
